channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Security companies are getting slammed with calls after the killing of UnitedHealthcare’s CEO
Shares of Apollo Global Management and Workday rally as they
A judge who served in the military for over 20 years upholds use of race in Naval Academy admissions, citing national security
item.description: Judge Richard Bennett wrote that the school had “established a compelling national security interest in a diverse officer corps.”

item.title: Nasdaq books fresh record close, S&P 500 logs weekly gain after U.S. jobs report
USDA orders nationwide testing of milk for bird flu to contain and eventually eliminate the virus
item.description: Dairy farmers and processors across the U.S. have been reluctant to test animals or milk for the virus, fearing economic or other repercussions.

item.title: The incredible health benefits of drinking enough water: New study highlights role in weight loss, migraines, and more
item.description: Researchers also found that adequate hydration can control diabetes, blood glucose levels, and low blood pressure.

item.title: Tesla’s stock closes at highest price in nearly 3 years. Why it can keep going.
The killing of a top health care executive has set the business world on edge as police search for answers
item.description: The CEO of UnitedHealthcare, Brian Thompson, was gunned down early Wednesday morning.

item.title: David Sacks and the coming crypto war over national security
Apollo Global Management, Workday shares rally as they're set to join S&P 500
